document.heading: Comprehensive Merit Personnel Reemployed Annuitant Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-172, the “Comprehensive Merit Personnel Reemployed Annuitant Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-571, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 21, 1994, and July 5, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-292 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-172 became effective on September 22, 1994.

meta.search-text: EN LLMENT(S) kwiktag ’~ 103 222 019 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 10-172 "Comprehensive Merit Personnel Reemployed Annuitant Amendment Act of 1994 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. I0-571 on first and second readings, June 21, 1994 and July 5, 1994, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on July 25, 1994, this legislation was assigned Act No. I0-292, and published in the August 5, 1994, edition of the D,C. Register (Vol 41 page 5152) and transmitted to Congress on July 28, 1994 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law I0-172 effective September 22, 1994. I VID A. CLARKE Chai~an of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: July August September 28,29 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,II,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,26 1 2,1 3,1 4,1 5,1 6,1 9,20,21 AN ACT D,C, ACT i0-292 Enrolled Original Oodiflc on District of Co ,umbia Code (19.95 Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA JULY 25, 1994 To amend the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978 so that federal and military retirees selected for employment in the District Government for service will not be subject to the reduction of pay allocable to the period of employment as a reemployed annuitant. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Comprehensive Merit Personnel Reemployed Annuitant Amendment Act of 1994 See. 2. Section l103(b) and (e) of the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978, effective March 3, 1979 (D.C. Law 2-139; D.C. Code § 1-612.3(b) and (c is amended as follows a) Subsection (b) is amended by deleting the phrase "federal or and (b) Subsection (c) is repealed. See. 3. This act shall apply prospectively to eligible employees beginning on the 1st pay period after the effective date of the Comprehensive Merit Personnel Reemployed Annuitant Amendment Act of 1994. Sec. 4. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C.
